briefTitle: Ketorolac in Postoperative Infants: Pharmacokinetics and Safety

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Non-prematurely-born infants admitted to hospital following surgery ages 2-18 months, studied by age group 12-18 months, 6-12 months, \< 6 months

Exclusion Criteria:

* Bleeding history in infant or family
* Coagulopathy
* Gastrointestinal bleeding history
* Renal or hepatic disease assessed by history and by pre-drug blood tests
* Premature birth (\<36 weeks gestation)

outcomeMeasures.title: Clearance of S-ketorolac and R+ Ketorolac in 2-6 Month Old Infants Following Surgery
outcomeMeasures.description: stereo-isomer specific clearance determined by population-based pharmacokinetic analysis (NONMEM)

outcomeMeasures.title: Central Volume of Distribution for S- and R+ Ketorolac in 2-6 Month Old Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: stereo-specific ketorolac analysis using population-based analysis (NONMEM)for ketorolac given intravenously 24 hours after surgery in 2-6 month old infants

outcomeMeasures.title: Peripheral Volume of Distribution for S- and R+ Ketorolac in 2-6 Month Old Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: peripheral volume of distribution for ketorolac stereo-isomers determined by population kinetic analysis (NONMEM)

outcomeMeasures.title: Half-life of S- and R+ Ketorolac in 2-6 Month Old Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: half-life calculated from non-compartmental analysis of ketorolac isomers in 2-6 month old infants given intravenous ketorolac following surgery

outcomeMeasures.title: Morphine Use in 2-6 Month Old Infants Given Ketorolac or Placebo Following Surgery
outcomeMeasures.description: total morphine given intravenously in the 12 hours following receiving intravenous ketorolac or placebo

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Time With Room Air Oximetry Saturations Under 90% in 2-6 Month Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: continuous oximetry monitoring of room air saturation was collected for 12 hours after intravenous infusion of ketorolac or placebo

outcomeMeasures.title: Clearance of S- and R+ Ketorolac in 6-18 Month Old Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: stereo-specific ketorolac clearance by population-based analysis (NONMEM)

outcomeMeasures.title: Volume of Distribution for Ketorolac Isomers in 6-18 Month Old Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: population-based kinetic analysis of ketorolac isomers following intravenous infusion in infants after surgery

outcomeMeasures.title: Ketorolac Stereo-isomer Volume of Distribution Peripheral in 6-18 Month Old Infants
Half-life of Ketorolac Stereo-isomers in 6-18 Month Old Infants After Surgery
outcomeMeasures.description: noncompartmental pharmacokinetic analysis of ketorolac stereo-isomers after intravenous infusion in postoperative infants

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Morphine Use in 6-18 Month Old Infants After Ketorolac or Placebo Intravenous Infusion After Surgery
outcomeMeasures.description: total amount of morphine given for 12 hours after ketorolac or placebo infusion in 6-18 month old infants after surgery

outcomeMeasures.title: Oximetry Saturation Under 90% After Ketorolac or Placebo Infusion in 6-18 Month Old Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: continuous oximetry monitoring for 12 hours after ketorolac or placebo intravenous infusion in 6-18 month old infants after surgery
